snippet: The question, posed in a letter from a House committee chairman, was part of an inquiry into how the Obama administration handled its officials’ use of personal email.
abstract: Records show that Hillary Rodham Clinton was asked by congressional investigators in December 2012 whether she used personal email to conduct business while serving as secretary of state, but did not reply to question; question was posed again in March 2013, two months after Clinton left office, but was again ignored; revelation sets up first test of Clinton's presidential campaign.
lead_paragraph: The question, posed in a letter from a House committee chairman, was part of an inquiry into how the Obama administration handled its officials’ use of personal email.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton Was Asked About Email 2 Years Ago
headline.print_headline: Mrs. Clinton Was Asked About Email 2 Years Ago
